title: 1.2 Basic API Structure
intro: This page describes the basic structure of each API call managed by the FieldLogs platform.

blocks.content: Each API call structure contains the following elements:

points.text: protocol : Defines the protocol to use to connect to the server. It must be https when going after production platform
servername : Defines the hostname of the server hosting the service. This can be the platform Main hostname, or the Grid Node hostname for account specific services.
webappname : Defines the API deployment. It must be MainWebApp when going after the Main host and GridWebApp when going after a Grid Node host.
apiVersion : Defines the version of the API to use. The latest version is always available at api/latest.
servicePath : Defines the API service to call. This is defined in each of the API calls documentation.
authenticationParameters : Defines the parameters and values that will identify the caller and authorize the access to the requested API service.
apiServiceParameters : Defines the parameters and values required to perform the API service call. These are specified for each API call documentation
